verse: In addition to his wisdom, Qoheleth taught the people knowledge, having weighed, studied, and arranged many proverbs.
Qoheleth sought to express his thoughts in a pleasing way and to convey truths with precision.
The sayings of the wise are as sharp as goads; like spikes firmly positioned are the lessons offered by a single shepherd.
In regard to anything beyond these, my child, beware. There is no end to the writing of many books, and extensive study results in a weariness of the flesh.
